data.title: Wonderful romantic meal
data.text:
Second time is a charm.
If you visit this restaurant make sure you are seated in the restaurant behind the bar. My first experience was disappointing as we were seated on a bench like seat in the bar.
Last night I started with a pineapple cocktail 
Mountain meadow mushroom ravioli.....incredible
Followed by beef tenderloins with potato purée, Brussels sprouts and a burgundy sauce
And Tiramisu for dessert.
We took our own wine and there was a corkage fee of $25
We drank a French red called " Legende Pauillac"
Service was first class, ambience delightful and the food exquisite

data.title: Poor Grades on Hospitality, Service, and Overpriced Menu
data.text: Once a year we choose a nice restaurant for a nice meal with our cousins, usually during Restaurant Week.  We had a reservation for 6:45 pm, and arrived at 6:35 pm.  We were told they would seat us "on time" and we would have to wait.  Nowhere to wait except out on the curb in front of the restaurant -- and hostess finally came to seat us at 6:42 pm  She explained that they didn't want to overtax the waiters,  but all we had wanted was to sit down, maybe a glass of water.  Waiter seemed to be very inexperienced.  Restaurant Week menu included 3 courses for $50 so we chose to use the regular menu, as dessert wasn't important to us.  We asked if our Passport Dining Cards could be used (buy one entree and get one entree complimentary) and were told we could use two cards per table -- since we were two couples, that was fine.  We had to send back a cocktail that wasn't prepared properly,  the bread was served with laughably insufficient butter,  and organic greens salad for $12 had a few sliced veggies and one tiny cherry tomato.  Courses were served very slowly.   Wine by the bottle was charged at same price as wine by the glass.  We shared a delicious dessert.  When we were presented our bill, we were told that the policy is to charge a whopping 20% service charge to anyone who uses a Passport Card.  With 5 glasses of wine, one cocktail, four appetizers and one dessert,  the 20% service charge wiped out any savings from the Passport Card.  We would have tipped the waiter appropriately,  and fairly,  but the 20% added to our bill made a difficult evening even more unpalatable.  Sad to say that we won't be returning to Bellamy's.  Poor hospitality,  poor service.  IF they are not prepared to participate in Restaurant Week, they should skip it.   AND if they are not interested in the Passport Card program, they should not be part of it.   If they want to make up the rules for their customers to follow, they should be very up front with what those rules will be.   There are so many nice restaurants in north county and on Grand Avenue now, I have no idea why anyone would want to overspend for a trip to Bellamy's.

data.title: We were disappointed!
data.text: We were headed to the restaurant next door but it was closed so we decided to try Bellamy;s.  We found it very noisy. We ate on the restaurant side and there were only about five other tables taken.  I was shocked at the prices. It took a long time to get served and I didn't feel the food was very good.  The menu was very limited. I will never go back.  I would not recommend that my friends go there.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: My wife and I were there to celebrate our anniversary.  We had reservations at 6:30.  Only one other table was occupied when we arrived.  The wait staff was very attentive and competent - everyone performed their role very smoothly.  We shared an appetizer (Baked Goat Cheese Crottin with beet salad).  The goat cheese had a distinct bleu cheese flavor.  My wife had the local sea bass with risotto - excellent.  I had the ceal cheek - excellent.  We will go back for other special occasions!

data.title: A real gem
data.text: We visited Bellamy's on a Tuesday night for an anniversary dinner.  Everything was wonderful from appetizer through dessert.  The sea bass with risotto and veal cheeks were both absolutely delicious.  Service was professional and unobtrusive.

data.title: A gem tucked away
data.text: You want innovating dishes, great service at reasonable prices, you don't have to go to a luxurious resort. Here in little Escondido, Patrick Posaty has created a fantastic restaurant with creative dishes not seen at more upscale places. Although Patrick is opening another restaurant in Rancho Santa Fe, I am sure he will still have a supervisory role in this one, we hope.

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: The decor is dated and faded but the kitchen sings! We had small but elegantly prepared and presented appetizers and entrees; service was slow but professional and good natured. Gluten free needs were happily accomodated. I look forward to returning.

data.title: Fine dining at its best!
data.text: So glad we stopped by last night for dinner!  Food, wine and service were all excellent.  My husband opted for the Chef's tasting menu with paired wines, which is in itself a great concept.  He loved every bite - and sip.  I had the gazpacho and scallops dishes; both remarkable.  As others have pointed out, prices are on the high end, but again, this is fine dining, the memorable kind, the "out of the ordinary" kind.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Birthday dinner
data.text: My wife and I had a delightful dinner for her Birthday. The service was friendly and attentive and the food was top notch. As an added surprise my wife was given a Creme Brulee  with a candle for her Birthday.

data.title: MCF 2016 San Diego
data.text: Very nice restaurant, top service thanks to Kristina and her team. Excellent food under Master Chef Patrick Ponsaty

data.title: Excellent in every way!
data.text: Bellamy's is a divine French restaurant offering a quality dinner menu with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The service here is superior. The price point is on the higher end but worthy of every penny spent. This is a great place for a special occasion dinner or romantic evening out. My husband had a tasty salmon dish and I had a delicious lamb and penne pasta casserole. This is fine dining at its best, right in downtown Escondido. It was a wonderful evening from start to finish. They have a nice bar area with piano music throughout the evening if you want to visit for a nice glass of wine or light meal.

data.title: Excellent French Cuisine!
data.text: Who would have thought that in the small town of Escondido, CA there would be such a fine French restaurant?!! Food is fresh and menus change with the seasons. A favorite is always the ravioli with porcini mushrooms. I had grouper with a lobster sauce last week -- delicious!! Really, we've never been disappointed. Oh, and the Gateau Basque for dessert is out of this world!!

data.title: Finally!!!!  An absolutely exceptional restaurant in Escondido!!!
data.text: Completely perfect meal!  Attentive, well trained, friendly staff!  Beautiful remodel of interior and food that is creative, delicious and beautifully presented.  Thank you!

data.title: Tias Birthday
data.text: Nice atmosphere, chairs were comfy, beautiful artwork. Gorgeous wood table and wood wall. Great service. Delicious food. Compliments to the Chef. Best steak sandwich I ever had. Niece and sister loved the salmon.

data.title: A French Culinary Gem in Escondido
data.text:
We moved to Escondido from Mt Helix about a year ago. We were afraid we would have to commute to the coast or downtown SD to get a great dining experience. But, to our surprise, we found a number of very good dining spots. Perhaps the best in the area, and I think best in California for food and drink excellence is Bellamy's right on Grand Ave. Patrick Ponsaty is one of the region's true treasures and we're very fortunate to have him in Escondido.

The happy hour is one of the best values anywhere with a number of delicious dishes half price. The wine list is extensive and relatively reasonable starting in the mid $30s. The mixed drinks are hand crafted with decent pours. The atmosphere is comfortable casual and fun with a piano player dishing out the American Song Book. This was our third time and we plan to make it a regular destination for our eating out nights.

The beet trio with ice cream is amazing as is the crab salad and paella. Order it if it's on the menu... you won't regret it.

data.title: Early dinner
data.text: Showed up about 5:30.  Pleasantly surprised to find the bar area re-decorated.  Much improved, more elegant, quiet and reserved.  Same outstanding service.

data.title: Expectations not realized
data.text: We all had Muscovy Duck. It was a bit over salted and the seasonings were too noticeable to make it more than an average dish. Expected more from their kitchen. The mushroom ravioli was good. Service was excellent. New decor was dark and kind of pedestrian. New chairs were super comfortable. Service was excellent. A lot of contradictions at this meal. Will try them again after they finish their remodel.

data.title: Nice meal, strange space
data.text: My Wife and I were invited by friends to join them here.  We arrived before them, so we waited in the lounge.  There was an unusual piano bar like an extra small baby grand shoved up against a pub table.  The lounge had some other quirky decor from the flooring to the the light fixtures to the random artwork.  We went and sat in the dining room when our friends arrived, and the hostess was very professional.  It seemed like a pretty limited menu.  Our friends went with a prix fixe as it was restaurant week, and it seemed that the waiter gave the impression that we should all do prix fixe.  For first course, my Wife had a soup which she liked--I think it was squash.  I had tuna tartare which was good too.  For entree I had fish which was a little overdone and tough.  I should have had the steak which our friends had, and they were satisfied.  Dessert was good--chocolate 3 ways.  Overall, it was an ok meal, but I'm not sure it's worth the $50/person.  I think I'd rather eat somewhere closer to the beach.

data.title: Food can be good, but service is "iffy"
data.text: We went in before a local movie and let the waitress know we needed food when it came up. Short story, one of the orders never came out and after 20 mins we had to bring it to the servers attention, and she then obviously made up stories like "it's on the way", when clearly the order was never put in. Every single Dîner who came in with or after us had been served thier food. Finally after 40 minutes we got our burger, which was good. She didn't apologize and offered a small discount, but it's the blatant lying. Just tell me "oops", bring me a sip of wine and we can make it work. The "flatbread" that day came on a soft bread, not a toast like we expected. I think they can be a great restaurant, the food is usually good. But, we were disappointed in the service and are hesitant to return.

data.title: Good spot
data.text: We usually eat at Vincent's when in Escondido, but based on reviews, decided to give this a try.  It was solid, but we'll continue with Vincent's.  Went here for lunch - wife had a cheeseburger that was $18 and was only a little above average.  I had smoked salmon crepes that were OK.  Staff and service was fine and ambience was good as well.  As I said, go to Vincent's - it's about 300 yards down the street.
